page.title: 05Catterick Village Fair
page.content: On Saturday 13th July 1985,one week before Saint Anne's Tide,{Catterick {Village Fair}was held on Low Green. The Fair was opened at 2.00pm by the {Rose Queen,}who arrived by pony and trap and made a speech. Local girls aged 10 years and over can enter the {Rose Queen Competition.}They have to read a passage from a book,and answer questions asked by a panel of judges.This year a Rose Queen and two attendants were chosen. Around Low Green about twenty tents were loaned and errected by the R.A.F. The tents contained stalls and games organised by village groups. There was a children's fancy dress competition, and a dancing display by children from Michael Syddall C.E. Primary School. The total raised was over Â£1,500. This is the major annual fund raising event for the{Parish Church.
